content: Subzone of Geylang Planning Area in Singapore **Aljunied** (/ælˈdʒuːnɪd/ *al-JOO-nid*) is a suburban area located in the central part of the [city-state](/wiki/City-state) of Singapore. Named after Aljunied Road, it was formerly agricultural land which has since been heavily urbanised and presently comprises a variety of land uses. Today, Aljunied is a bustling neighbourhood with [HDB](/wiki/Housing_and_Development_Board) [flats](/wiki/Apartment) with amenities like shops, schools, parks and recreational facilities, as well as several traditional Singaporean shophouses. ## Etymology Syed Sharif Omar bin Ali Al Junied owned large tracts of agricultural land in the area. In [Palembang](/wiki/Palembang), he established a business after migrating from his hometown in [Tarim](/wiki/Tarim,_Yemen), [Yemen](/wiki/Yemen). Syed Omar came from the well-respected Arab family who were [descendants](/wiki/Kinship) of the [Islamic prophet](/wiki/Prophets_in_Islam) [Muhammad](/wiki/Muhammad). Masjid Kampong Melaka was renamed [Masjid Omar Kampong Melaka](/wiki/Masjid_Omar_Kampong_Melaka) in his honour. In 1823, at the behest of [Stamford Raffles](/wiki/Stamford_Raffles), Syed Omar donated the land on which [St Andrew's Cathedral](/wiki/St_Andrew%27s_Cathedral,_Singapore) now stands. He and his family also donated land for the establishment of [Tan Tock Seng Hospital](/wiki/Tan_Tock_Seng_Hospital). Syed Omar's descendants continue to reside in Singapore. Madrasah Aljunied was a leading Islamic religious school that produced many religious leaders of Southeast Asian countries. ## Education This section **does not cite any sources**. Please help improve this section by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *(January 2023)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* Aljunied formerly falls under [Aljunied Constituency](/wiki/Aljunied_Constituency) from 1959 to 1988. In 1968, the MacPherson area of Aljunied was under [MacPherson Constituency](/wiki/MacPherson_Single_Member_Constituency) and in 1988, renamed as MacPherson Single Member Constituency (SMC). In 1988, both wards were merged into [Aljunied Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Aljunied_Group_Representation_Constituency) (GRC). In 1991, the MacPherson area went under [Marine Parade GRC](/wiki/Marine_Parade_Group_Representation_Constituency) and then became its own individual constituency again as [MacPherson Single Member Constituency](/wiki/MacPherson_Single_Member_Constituency) (SMC) again in 1997. In 2001, the MacPherson area was merged back into Marine Parade GRC again and split back as MacPherson SMC again in 2015. - [Aljunied MRT station](/wiki/Aljunied_MRT_station) - [Geylang East Public Library](/wiki/Geylang_East_Public_Library) - [Buddhist Library (Singapore)](/wiki/Buddhist_Library_(Singapore)) - [Foo Hai Ch'an Monastery](/wiki/Foo_Hai_Ch%27an_Monastery) - Victor R Savage, Brenda S A Yeoh (2003), *Toponymics - A Study of Singapore Street Names*, Eastern Universities Press, [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 981-210-205-1
